transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I just don't know what to do, Tad. (sniff) I'm at the end of my rope.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah, well...

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Everything was going so great, (sniff) and the Cartoon Network calls me up and says, "oh, sorry, Harvey, but we're passing on your late night show." Just like that, they clip my wings.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, look, Harvey, I really am sorry about your show, but--

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Sylvia's left me, you know, and so has Falcon 7. (sniff) Soon as they heard, the two of them just flew off, faster than you can say... "Biiiiirrrrddd Maaaa--" (coughs violently) (sniff)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, wellll...

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Look, Tad, can I borrow some money?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh... Sorry, Harvey, no can do.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Please, Tad, my Hanna-Barbera royalties ran out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, Harv, why don't you call Frankenstein Jr.? The guy's got cash galore!

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: I called Frankenstein Jr.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about the Herculoids?

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Eh, eh, listen, I've called the Herculoids. They laughed at me, blobs and all.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Llllook, I'm sorry, Harvey, but I have a show to do here.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Sure, sure, rub it in. Thanks, pal. Thanks for nothin'. (fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (tsk tsk tsk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?! Like you were gonna lend him money?

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Hello, and welcome to my nightmare! It's Space Ghost Coast to Coast! Tonight, performance artist Laurie Anderson, and percussion group Stomp. Plus, Zorak and the Original Way Outs. And now, here he is, he's behind the second set of double doors, after we go down this long hallway, my best friend, Seth Garden!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Ahem! Bon soir, citizens and citizenettes! I am Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The other white meat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, nothin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What is it with you anyways, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, it's a mantis thing. You wouldn't understand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Darn right I wouldn't, my little chucklebug. But I do understand this: tonight we're going to experience yet another rip-roaring slab of quality talk show entertainment.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Tonight my guests are performance artist and downtown musician type Laurie Anderson, and noise-happy avant garde percussion group Stump, uh, Stomp. (to himself) Eh, sounds artsy-fartsy.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in beatnik getup) Cool!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Cool, nothing! Art and TV don't mix, everybody knows that! If people wanted to see art on TV, they'd, they'd say, "hey, y'know, I wanna see art on TV!"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's what they'd say...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The desk. Remember.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know where the desk is!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays Space Ghost to the desk, with some electronic pop music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Um, okay, I'm ready, let's do it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, everyone, it's Laurie Anderson, the art freak! A real life artistic type, right here on TV. Welcome, citizen Anderson, are you getting enough oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Not at the moment, no, are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Eh, am I getting enough oxygen! (laughs) Did you hear that, Moltar? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I heard. Here's your air, lady. (throws a lever)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sooo, Laurie, I hear you're an artist. Sounds difficult.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: It's hard to be an artist, don't you think?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah, I guess so. (quietly) Uh, look, Laurie, for the sake of my ratings, would you please try not to actually do any art, on the show tonight?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whew! Great! As an "artiste", you must watch a lot of quality television, like, uh, my show, for instance!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Hmm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, the boob tube!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: You know, I, I absolutely never watch television.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you're one of those, are ya? (mocking) "Let's stay home and read."

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: What's 'at?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said that, it says here that you work with computers a lot. Y'know, I bought a computer once. It tried to kill me.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: I have eleven computers.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eleven! That's like--

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's like, one louder than ten.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: One more than ten, would be the thing, what's "louder" got to do with it?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: I have a lot of equipment, I probably have, um, a hundred, remote controls.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get out! That's way more than eleven!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: I have a lot.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jeez! All right, you win! Emasculator!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! You know a big word?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What, eleven?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Now, I can obviously ask you questions too, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Okay

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: What's your favorite ice cream?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like cake.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: What's your favorite city?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like cake.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: What's your favorite organ?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like -- Ummmm, uh, Zorak, what do you think?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, this is the Gold Key XG5 3000.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: With the sampler thingie, right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yyyes, just listen! (plays "Jingle Bells" with Zorak's sampled voice saying "Die!")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pretty fancy, eh, Laurie?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's not bad.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Any more questions, Laurie?

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: You on-line?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like cake.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: That's the thing I like most about being on-line, it's invisibility.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yah, I can do that. (invisos out)

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Oops, where'd you go? (laughs) Hey! He's gone again, so alone here.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: For good, I hope.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Laurie! Moltar & I are on-line. We talked to Larry Storch in a chat room once.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Good, okay, good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: My on-screen name is "lonemantisoftheapocalypse@ghostplanet.com"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: My on-screen name is "hotboy@.." somethin' somethin'.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Settle a bet for us; who created cyberspace? Al Gore or Sega!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: It's not Al Gore!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ahhh, nuts!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: Richard Milhous Nixon.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No way!

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: He was the guy to cut the, you know, took the country off the gold standard. So after that, then money was abstract, it was nothing, it was like, it was just numbers...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Behold! (invisos back out again)

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: ... and once it becomes so completely ethereal, then it can be anything, then you can have, like, the 80's happen, y'know, which it did, like, right away. But, you know, that, it was that, those were, that was the first, um, thing that, I think, the, uh, invention of cyberspace was really about those banks...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in, then yawns) Behold! (flies off into space)

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: ... So, I think if it was a leap of faith for people to put their money in there, and think that it was doing, going somewhere, you know?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Laurie Anderson
transcript.dialogue: You agree?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (from out in space) Sure it's free!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Space Ghost on control room monitor) Laurie's still down here, are you done?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: With what?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The interview?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm out here!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I know, I got you on the monitor. Uh, shall we go to break, or what? Break?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh. (pause) Hey! Anybody need saving out here?

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: No, no, I think I'm okay. (long pause) Yeah, yeah, I'm okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor, to Moltar) Is she gone?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk) (sighs) Okay now! We're going to talk with several members of Team Stomp. And, they're going to perform for us afterwards?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This better not be anything like that Anderson--

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, sends Chad to the studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Chad Kukahiko
transcript.dialogue: Hi, I'm Chad--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Chad!? My evil lunatic twin brother?!

transcript.speaker: Chad Kukahiko
transcript.dialogue: (grins back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You grew a pony tail!

transcript.speaker: Chad Kukahiko
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah, why not?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looks on)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looks on)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (nervous laugh) Oh, sorry, I thought, I thought you were my Chad. So, you're...

transcript.speaker: Chad Kukahiko
transcript.dialogue: I am Chad Kukahiko, member of Stomp, and alien.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, why is your group called Stomp?

transcript.speaker: Chad Kukahiko
transcript.dialogue: Um, because what we do more often than anything else, is just smack things, and, stomp on things, it's a onomatopoeia. You can look that up in a dictionary, if you don't know what that means, but it's sort of--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts him off the monitor) (sighs) It was bound to happen once today. Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, sends Ameenah to the studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, citizen...

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... please identify yourself to the universe.

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: I am Ameenah Kaplan.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever been in space before?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no, not, not that I can recall. I mean, perhaps in my sleep, the aliens, they come, whatever, but not that I can recall.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scoots closer) So, can you explain to me why you are called Stomp?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: Because we stomp on the ground with our... feet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) (with sarcasm) Hey, I get it now! They stomp on the ground with their feet! And, people pay to see that?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what superpowers do you have?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: My superpowers? I have, I can... (shakes her head) None. I was gonna lie...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, good for you!

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: No, I was gonna lie, you see, but, you know, I decided just to tell the truth.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ewwgh! Suck-up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what role do you play in Stomp?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I hit things really hard--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Could you give us a sample of what you'll all be doing for us later?

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: You mean, like a circus animal, like, just to start performing?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, exactly like a circus animal.

transcript.speaker: Ameenah Kaplan
transcript.dialogue: You have some balls I can juggle and stand on one foot?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You bet. Ladies and gentlemen, Mitzi, the Dancing Elephant!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox... Matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, matchbox, eh... (pause) This is boring. (pause) Is this all they do?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That's about the extent of it, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) I'm goin' back out.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, you want me to shut everything off when we're done?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (yawning) Uh huh, shut everything off when you're done.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Should we try to escape when you're gone?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Me and Moltar, him and me, should we, try to escape?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh... No, don't escape.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Where're you goin', anyway?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on... (Stomp finishes their number) Are they done?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ummm... uh... (they start performing another number) No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) I'm goin' back out.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Should I... roll the credits?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, what the hey.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I, I already did it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, um... good job.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Where're you goin', anyway? Can I ask that, or is it personal?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I don't know. Out there. Somewhere.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Anywhere near a video store?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Could you return something for me? If I gave it to you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure! Hey, uh, you want I should bring something back?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, "The Spawning", get "The Spawning"!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not gonna get "The Spawning". What is the one, yeah, you know, the one with the three guys and the baby?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No! Don't get that!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No! Do NOT get that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Euhhhhhh... Gutenberg..

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!
